core_principles: Immersion through Depth: Use darkening gradients and parallax to simulate physical descent.
Minimalism: Content is king. No UI clutter. The UI is the ocean.
Cinematic Pacing: Slow down the deeper you go. Allow negative space to build tension.
Atmosphere: Audio and particles are as important as visual elements.

scale.creature_label: text-xs md:text-sm tracking-[0.2em] uppercase font-medium text-white/80

structure: Fixed UI Layer: Depth Gauge, Mute Toggle, Explore Button (Hidden initially)
Background Layer: CSS Gradient + TSParticles (Marine Snow)
Content Layer: Sections with Parallax Elements

DepthGauge.position: Fixed right center or bottom right
DepthGauge.style: Minimal vertical line with current depth indicator

Section.layout: Flex column, centered or offset. High usage of negative space.

MarineLife.visuals: Simple white/transparent SVGs or CSS shapes. Subtle floating animation.

Particles.config: Direction: top to bottom (slow), color: #fff, opacity: 0.2, size: random small

audio.ambient: Deep underwater drone sound (low frequency loop)
audio.interaction: Subtle bubble pop or sonar ping on hover

assets.visuals_instructions: Use 'image_selector_tool' to find simple, high-contrast, black-and-white or transparent background marine life images if SVGs are not available. Search terms: 'jellyfish silhouette', 'whale silhouette', 'anglerfish illustration minimal'. Prefer converting these to white via CSS filters (brightness(0) invert(1)) if they are black.

instructions_to_main_agent: 1. Setup 'lenis' for smooth scrolling immediately. Standard scroll will feel cheap.
2. Implement a global 'scroll progress' state to drive the background gradient.
3. Use 'framer-motion' for all entrances. Elements should fade in and float up slowly.
4. For marine life images: Use the 'image_selector_tool' with the provided queries. Apply CSS 'filter: brightness(0) invert(1)' to make them white silhouettes if they are dark.
5. Ensure the 'DepthGauge' is always visible and readable.
6. The background MUST be a fixed container with a gradient that changes based on scroll percentage, OR a very tall div with a CSS gradient background.
7. Audio is key: Add a mute toggle. Auto-play might be blocked, so start audio on first interaction (scroll/click).
8. Mobile responsiveness: Ensure text doesn't overlap illustrations. Stack them vertically on mobile.
universal_guidelines: Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur)
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: transition: all. This results in breaking transforms.
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add .App { text-align: center; }
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations
NEVER: use AI assistant Emoji characters like ðŸ¤–ðŸ§  for icons.
Every interaction needs micro-animations - hover states, transitions, parallax effects.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable.
Component Reuse: Prioritize using pre-existing components from src/components/ui.
Export Conventions: Components MUST use named exports. Pages MUST use default exports.
All interactive and key informational elements MUST include a 'data-testid' attribute.
